p: Successively we analysed separately, realizing dose-response curves, the oils extracted from M. piperita, using various % v/ v as indicated in the methods. As shown in the Figure 3, MpH1 was the most active on all the bacterial strains used: in particular, at the concentration of 1%, it killed all the bacteria. Besides, increasing the temperature of the heat shock the antimicrobial activity seems to decrease, in all cases except for S. aureus. All the oils were more active on the bacilli and slightly less on S. aureus and S. epidermidis.
